fields.description:
Reproduce (using demotion from 11 Jun 2009):
1. Join CR-FE-1986
2. Keep pressing {{y}} to mark each file as reviewed (none should be bold in the tree).
3. Click 'Complete' in the top right.

Expected:
- Review receipt.

Actual:
- Warning about 1 unreviewed file.
fields.summary: Can't mark a deleted directory as reviewed
gravitar icons on dashboard not showing in safari 3

fields.description:
After resizing the files pane (either by resizing the window or the navigation tree pane) comment widths should be adjusted so that they're completley visible in the files pane.

This isn't happening in IE7.
fields.summary: Comments aren't resized in IE7

fields.description:
The DOM as interpreted in IE7 is different to the DOM as interpreted in FireFox.

The major difference is that all the {{div.frxouter}} s should be decendents of {{#frxs}}, but in IE7 they're all siblings.

So validate and fix up and broken HTML so that the DOMs are the same across browsers.
fields.summary: Fix review page DOM for IE7

fields.description:
See the screenshot comparing IE7 and Firefox.

The screenshot is taken after the initial load of the page (in each browser).

This also means that deep links to comments or files don't start in the proper scroll position, since the file of the link is loaded first, then files above it are loaded (expanded), causing the target position (of the link) to go out of view.
fields.summary: Files don't start collapsed in IE7 all-files view

fields.description: IE7 doesn't let you scroll all the way to the left, so that active file marker in the left margin isn't visible in the scrollable pane.

{quote}
* a method to get allowed reviewers (according to permission scheme) for:
a. selected review
b. new review being just created for selected project
{quote}

Can be established by exposing com.cenqua.crucible.model.Project.getAllowedReviewers() in the spi.

fields.description:
Make the functionality offered by the com.cenqua.crucible.explorers package available through rest.

Also see the Connector's request (CRUC-1304):

{quote}
a method which would return the data about the traffic/content of the repository:
a. like in Manage Files | Changesets (so list of changests + files inside) - for selected repository and time period
b. like in Manage Files | Files (repo content) - for selected repository and path (directory)
This data would be used to create review in aforementioned manner
{quote}

fields.description:
If the user has set the review page to fullscreen and then a page refresh/reload happens for some reason. If a cookie is set on fullscreen setup, the page can reapply the user defined UI.

Reckon it'll make for some less frustrated users.

I'd set the cookie of the page URL, not the section, and have it never expire. I think its more intuitive to have it always be the way it was last left rather than have to reset it over the course of its use.
fields.summary: On reload or refresh, the users fullscreen setting is lost. Add a cookie to preserve it.

You are running release CR2.0.0.B2 FE2.0.0.B2 (build-392 2009-05-29), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

fields.summary: Error after upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment is not possible to add custom fields to reviews.

Examples of the field that would be needed are:
* *type* (in the original customer request they were looking for four types: informal; commentary; walkthrough; and full reading). 
* *review time* (of each reviewer). This could be used further to create statistics on review time 
* *feature ID* (so to make further analysis related on review time/volume based on a feature)
* *Team Name* (so to make further analysis related on review time/volume based on team) 
* *Review volume* (initial esteem of the review size so to give an idea of time needed to complete it to involved reviewers) 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a page in Administration to add custom fields for reviews (applied to all the reviews)
Provide the possibility to add custom fields to a review while creating it.

Custom fields could have types like: Choice (between configured values), Number, String, Time etc.
fields.summary: Custom fields for Crucible Review
File time stamps are not preserved in the backup

fields.description:
Happened on EAC:
1. Go to changeset 37012 in an activity stream (http://localhost:6060/crucible/changelog/FE/?showid=37012)
2. Using the more menu, add that changeset to a review.
3. Add it to review CR-FE-1758.

Prior to the above steps, {{JoinTag.java}} in CR-FE-1758 has 10 comments (all on the single revision as it is a new file in the review).
After adding 37012 to the review, JoinTag.java has no comments rendered (see attached image) even though the review still counts these comments.

UPDATE: It appears that no comments are rendered because there are actually two versions of the file in the review.
fields.summary: Adding a changeset to a review results in duplicate FRXs

fields.description:
1. Upload two images to diff.
2. Move the diff slider.
3. NPE results.

fields.description: In the review suggestions dialog, the table listing the reviews uses the old style inline review dialog.
fields.summary: Suggested reviews dialog uses old style inline review dialog

fields.description:
The inline review dialog that comes up when hovering over the review perma ID in a review list doesn't include review actions, e.g.,
- Summarize
- Abandon, etc.
fields.summary: Review actions missing from inline review dialog

fields.description:
The monkey was the best feature of FE/Cru 2.0.

Maybe a configuration setting?
fields.summary: Bring back the monkey!

fields.description:
The review comments link is unintuitive.

It should display "Show Review Comments" and "Hide Review Comments" when necessary instead of the current "Review Comments" all the time. It's hard to tell whether there are any and if I've got the review comments displayed or not.
fields.summary: Review comments link should toggle its label

fields.description: http://imagebin.ca/view/u7jH69.html
fields.summary: "You do not have permission to see all the search results." Looks crap.

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Open settings dialog
2. Don't change anything
3. Click close

It reloads the page for no reason.
fields.summary: Opening the user settings dialog and then closing it reloads the page

fields.description: At the moment Crucible reports are rendered on the Reports page, which has a repository context and is +not available in Crucible standalone mode+.
fields.summary: Find a home for report plugins in Crucible standalone

fields.description: There are possibly other buttons ('next comment') that warrant disabling, also.
fields.summary: Synchronise comment buttons when states are changed

fields.description: Making the slider snap is easy, but it makes it completely obvious that the labels on the slider are incorrectly positioned.
fields.summary: Fix rev slider labels so that slider can snap

fields.description:
The user {{time@atlassian.com}} has no display name when rendereing a user hover link.

If the user has no name stored, we should still send something down as a display name, probably their email address.
fields.summary: User has no display name
Selecting changeset in Manage Files fails

fields.description:
See this comment: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-CLOV-138/#c17054

Source file in question was SourceRegion.java

SourceRegion used to be a class but is now an interface with the original impl now in SimpleSourceRegion.java. Fisheye seems to think the file was added in the latest commit which doesn't seem right (perhaps to do with the SVN shenanigans IDEA sometimes goes through with refactorings like this).
fields.summary: Unable to add source file to review
fix styling of crucible project side bar
No way to change frx softwrap setting

fields.summary: Account signup pages still use old styles

fields.summary: Draft comments remain styled as drafts when posted

fields.summary: No horizontal scroll bar in review page

fields.description: Creating a new review with the user's timezone set to sydney on a US server yields a review popup that reports the creation time lies 5 hours in the future.
fields.summary: Timezone problem in review popup

fields.description: This startReview method will allow user to start a review process from draft state
fields.summary: Add REST methods to allow start review from draft

fields.description:
Problem statement: when using remote API if Crucible server is restarted client doesn't know that its session was invalidated. Server happily returns data for anonymous user. No method will tell you that client uses invalid session.

If affects Atlassian Eclipse Connector - after Crucible server is restarted or network settings are changed AEC user will see different list of reviews because its not logged in anymore. We have a workaround for this - every call we authenticate user but it'd be great if Crucible could tell us: "sorry mate, your session is invalid, please authenticate again".

Related issue https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/ACC-31
fields.summary: REST API should notify client if session token is invalid
Downloaded Binary tars (*.tar.gz) file is different from original file before upload
